intro: Salacia prinoides var. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved salacia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically orange to red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
